ComicInfo.Summary:
An Appetite for ...Life?: In a rare Rufferto back-cover strip that connects to the main story, Rufferto walks through a barren land that he recalls (in illustration-thought-balloons) was once filled with animals, birds and fish. To his horror, he imagines that Groo (with his massive appetite) has gorged himself on all of the absent wildlife. As he comes upon a meal-munching Groo, he breathes a sigh of relief to find that Groo has merely waylaid a traveling food merchant for his slobbering sustenance... and not indulged in a nature-devastating chow-down.
Groo In the Wild Chapter 4: Groo frees cartloads of wild spotted pumis from hunters as only he can. King Putrio summons a pair of mighty fishing ships commanded by Captain Ahax to further disrupt the balance of nature by "scoop[ing] up every fish and crustacean within leagues of the shore" for Putrio to sell at faraway markets at great profit. Groo unknowingly thwarts that plan by inadvertently sinking both vessels. With that, the council that set Putrio up as king to make them all wealthier turns on him and runs the ex-king off into the hills. Groo has saved the environment, but only a proud Rufferto knows.
